text.p: The central bank lent banks 27.8 trillion lira overnight money at 75 percent on Wednesday after draining 54.23 trillion lira through open market operations earlier in the day.
The bank collected 54.23 trillion lira via a 14-day reverse repo auction at 74.86 percent average rate in the morning to control a 67 trillion lira surplus left from hefty t-bill maturities.

The lira traded at 74 and 74.75 percent in the morning, but rose to 75 percent in the afternoon as the central bank stepped in to feed cash to meet increasing cash demand. It had funded 25 trillion lira at 75 percent on Tuesday.

The treasury sold 69.62 trillion lira worth 182-day t-bills in an auction on Tuesday for which banks paid 44.7 trillion lira to the Treasury today, in return for 128.1 trillion lira cashed in from maturing t-bills.
The lira closed weaker at 98,410 to the dollar due to the dollar's gains against the mark in the international markets. It opened at 98,450 against Tuesday's 97,960 close.
Bankers said currency trade was dull because liquidity tighthened after the reverse repo auction.
Yields on t-bills and bonds with 1997 maturities ended mixed in narrow ranges.

The average yield on the most heavily traded October 30, 1997 paper was unchanged at 117.20 percent. The second most active June 4, 1997 paper yielded 117.53 percent, up slightly from Tuesday's 116.89 percent average.
